text.long: A Campaign is a series of linked scenarios fought over the broken regions of Coffin Canyon. Factions quarrel over boomtown ruins, poisoned rivers, feral biomes, industrial scars, and storm-ridden badlands—each battle reshaping the land itself. Coffin Canyon is not a neutral battlefield. It is an injured place, and every action leaves a mark.

green_storm.title: The Canyon and the Green Storm
green_storm.long: The Canyon was torn open by reckless mining and Thyr extraction. Rivers were poisoned, soil corrupted, and the air fractured. These wounds culminated in the Green Storm Catastrophe—toxic storms, spore-clouds, and harmonic backlash that still surge across the land. The Canyon did not heal. Instead, it entered a cycle of States—environmental conditions that define what can survive, what resources exist, and how difficult it is for men and monsters to endure. A Campaign tracks these changes.

territories.title: Territories
territories.long: A Territory represents a defined region of Coffin Canyon. Each Territory always exists in one Canyon State.

canyon_states.title: Canyon States
canyon_states.long: Canyon States are environmental conditions, not just ownership. They define terrain, storms, morale, and resource flow.

poisoned.name: Poisoned
environment: Green Storms of toxic air, spore clouds, and corrosive rain
Food grown here is tainted unless treated
effects: Humans suffer attrition, fatigue, or morale penalties
Monsters are less affected; some thrive

lawless.name: Lawless
plant_life: Crops exist only in guarded pockets
effects: Monsters are hunted, sold, or driven off

haunted.name: Haunted
effects: Manlings suffer morale and fear penalties

strangewild.name: Strangewild
effects: Humans suffer movement and visibility penalties
Beasts gain ambush and mobility advantages

exalted.name: Exalted
terrain: Hanging cages of monsters and men

rusted.name: Rusted
terrain: Seized engines fused into the earth
effects: Humans suffer respiratory and equipment degradation

liberated.name: Liberated
effects: Monsters weakened or unable to breathe the air

extracted.name: Extracted
effects: Monsters mutilated, hybridized, or escaped failures

held.name: Held
terrain: Ley markers and stabilized ley lines

state_shifts.title: State Shifts
process: Highest VP faction is Dominant Influence
state_shifts.notes: Some States resist change. Some victories only damage a State rather than replace it.

campaign_flow.title: Campaign Flow
steps: Choose a Territory and note its State

death_and_restocking.title: Death & Restocking
rules: Income is added to the Faction Budget
Replace dead units at base cost
Equipment and recruits may cost more or less by State
No long injury trees by default

friendly_territories.title: Friendly Territories
benefits: Reinforcement costs reduced by 1 credit per unit
Gain one free basic resource after the battle
Optional scenario advantages such as cover, deployment, or intel

campaign_end.title: Ending a Campaign
campaign_end.condition: A Campaign ends when one faction controls two-thirds or more of all Territories.
campaign_end.epilogue: The Canyon does not recover. It simply remembers who broke it last.
